project.teaser: Demographic trends in Europe are posing a challenge to the construction sector, which is facing labour shortage, and an aging existing workforce. This can be addressed through the integrated adoption of breakthrough technologies, e.g. autonomous vehicles, collaborative...
project.objective: Demographic trends in Europe are posing a challenge to the construction sector, which is facing labour shortage, and an aging existing workforce. This can be addressed through the integrated adoption of breakthrough technologies, e.g. autonomous vehicles, collaborative robotics, additive manufacturing, smart wearables, digital twin, and artificial intelligence, which can help to get construction tasks done with more efficacy, while at the same time making the sector more attractive to young people, and improving the safety, productivity, quality and environmental impact of construction projects. BEEYONDERS will take a leap forward in the design, development, and integration of these breakthrough technologies in real construction scenarios, bringing together the capabilities of European stakeholders, thus also demonstrating how the dependency on technology import from outside Europe can be reduced. Solutions will be developed for supporting the integration of autonomous and tele-operated, ground and aerial robotic platforms and heavy equipment in harsh environments. Innovative additive manufacturing solutions will be developed for resource optimization and for protection of biodiversity in maritime works. Safety, wellbeing, and training of workers will be improved through the development of exoskeletons, advanced wearables, and learning resources supported by XR technologies. A Digital Twin enriched with AI-based layers for decision-making will support seamless integration and management of all Project technologies. These will be tested and validated in 6 demonstration case studies covering different project typologies: tunnels, earthworks for road construction, buildings, maritime infrastructures, and road maintenance. BEEYONDERS impact will be evaluated both from the point of view of users? acceptance (e.g. benefits for aging workforce, attraction of young workers, contribution to gender balance in construction) and environment(e.g.LCA&LCC applied to all project).

result.title: System Requirements
result.description: "Te deliverable: ""System Requirements"" will be dedicated to the generation and description of the general objectives of the project, which must be present throughout its duration. It is mainly related to T2.1, and together with the requirements of T2.2, will serve to guide the developments carried out in the technical WPs."

result.title: LCA/LCC KPIs
result.description: "The deliverable: ""LCA/LCC KPIs"" will comprises the development of LCC and LCA KPIs, which will be used for circularity assessment of the implementation of new BT. KPIs will consider sustainability requirements (multi adaptability, lifespan extension options, high value recycling / re-use options, carbon capture capacity, etc.). Quantitative methods to verify these KPIs will be integrated into the Digital Twin database, allowing a visualization on its dedicated interface. These developed KPIs will be validated and enhanced in close collaboration with other project partners in other WPs and applied on the case studies of WP7. This deliverable will be mainly related to the task T2.3."

result.title: Dynamic and Static Assistive Strategies for a Tailored Occupational Back-Support Exoskeleton: Assessment on Real Tasks Carried Out by Railway Workers

details.authors: Christian Di Natali; Tommaso Poliero; Vasco Fanti; Matteo Sposito; Darwin G. Caldwell
details.journalTitle: Bioengineering

result.title: Time-lapse Image Processing for Estimating Construction Equipment Emissions

details.authors: Vimal Bharathi, Kepong Hong, Jochen Teizer
details.journalTitle: Annual Conference of the International Group for Lean Construction, Proceedings of the 33rd Annual Conference of the International Group for Lean Construction (IGLC 33)

result.title: Workers KPIs
result.description: "The deliverable: ""Workers KPIs"" comprises a list of worker KPIs covering safety, health, well-being, technology acceptance, and worker performance. It will define and categorize them to provide a measurement framework to assess the impact of BT on the workforce. It will be mainly related to the task T2.4"

result.title: Testing Plan and Report
result.description: D2.5 will have 2 versions M15 and M24. This deliverable is about Testing Plan and Report and needs an update to consider both the initial considerations for testing plan (M15) and the results obtained in this phase (M24). This deliverable will comprise the design and the stablishment of the methodology for the technologies to be followed, to assure that medium TRL5 is well stablished prior to the TRL6 validation in WP7. It will be mainly related to T2.5.

result.title: Digital construction site layout planning and real-time trajectory analysis for proactive safety monitoring and control of struck-by hazards

details.authors: Kepeng Hong, Jochen Teizer
details.journalTitle: Automation in Construction

result.title: Technology Market Outlook report
result.description: "The deliverable: ""Technology Market Outlook report"" will include the results related to the alignment of the project developments with the actual market needs, incorporating the monitoring of the related technology trends and associated markets and the international competitive technologies. This deliverable will be mainly associated to the task T8.3."

result.title: State of the Art Review of Technological Advancements for Safe Tower Crane Operation

details.journalTitle: Proceedings of the International Symposium on Automation and Robotics in Construction (IAARC)

result.title: Common Methodology and Specifications for Case Study Development and Technology Integration Assessment
result.description: "The deliverable: ""Common Methodology and Specifications for Case Study Development and Technology Integration Assessment"" will include the results related to a common methodology for ensuring a coherent development of the demonstration and validation activities (T7.2 to T7.7). Besides, common templates prepared for the reporting of the demonstration campaigns, and for the collection and analysis of data will be included. This deliverable will be mainly related to the task T7.1."

result.title: Learning Activities Resources
result.description: "The deliverable: ""Learning Activities Resources"" will include the results on the creation and testing of a first kind of multiplayer user-centric active and serious gaming learning environment that will enhance the understanding of construction trainees or the existing workforce for the identification and mitigation of various risk levels in a construction workplace. This deliverable will be mainly related to the task T5.3."

category.title: robotics
category.displayCode: /engineering and technology/electrical engineering, electronic engineering, information engineering/electronic engineering/robotics

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
